page.shortlink: api client api a5 u element setscroll method

argument.name: element
argument.description: A pointer to a DOM element or the ID of an element.

argument.name: x
argument.description: The X location in pixels to scroll.

argument.name: y
argument.description: The Y location in pixels to scroll.

argument.name: childElement
argument.description: A pointer to a child DOM element or the ID of an child element to scroll to.

argument.name: scrollAbsSettings
argument.description: Scroll setting for an absolute (X/Y) scroll.

property.name: fireEvent
property.description: Set to true to fire the native scroll event once the scrolling has been set. The default is false.

property.name: axis
property.description: What axes to scroll on. Values can be "both", "x" or "y".

property.name: animation
property.description: If the A5 frameworks custom scrolling is being used, whether to preform the scroll with an animation from the current location to the new location.

property.name: allow
property.description: Set to true to allow the animation. The default is false.

property.name: duration
property.description: The duration (in milliseconds) the that the animation should take.

argument.name: scrollToSettings
argument.description: Scroll setting for a scroll to child element scroll.

property.name: mode
property.description: How the child element should be scrolled to. The default value is "into-view", which will scroll the child element into view with the least amount of scrolling (child element aligned to the nearest edge). A value of "top" will scroll the element so that it is at the top of the scrollable area. A value of "bottom" will scroll the element so that it is at the bottom of the scrollable area.

property.name: x
property.description: The number of pixels extra to add to the X axis. For example, a value of 10 will mean that the element will be scrolled so that it is 10 pixels away from the edge of the scrollable area.

property.name: y
property.description: The number of pixels extra to add to the Y axis. For example, a value of 10 will mean that the element will be scrolled so that it is 10 pixels away from the edge of the scrollable area.

property.name: fireEvent
property.description: Set to true to fire the native scroll event once the scrolling has been set. The default is false.

property.name: axis
property.description: What axes to scroll on. Values can be "both", "x" or "y".

property.name: animation
property.description: If the A5 frameworks custom scrolling is being used, whether to preform the scroll with an animation from the current location to the new location.

property.name: allow
property.description: Set to true to allow the animation. The default is false.

property.name: duration
property.description: The duration (in milliseconds) the that the animation should take.

page.description: Sets the scroll position of the passed in element.

discussion.p: A5.u.element.setScroll can be used to set the scroll position of an element whether the element is using the A5 frameworks custom scrolling (drag scrolling for mobile), or the browser native scrolling. The absolute X/Y location can be passed in, or a child element to scroll to.
